cronutrient deficiencies may 
coexist in the obese, especially in those of low socioeconomic status [125] (Annex 3). The causes of most 
micronutrient deficiencies during pregnancy and obesity may be similar in most cases; that is, with poor diets 
and reduced intakes and/or absorption of several micronutrients, in combination with an increased demand 
for and sequestration of fat-soluble vitamins by excess adipose tissue. A range of studies showed that the
